books.title: The Mother
books.author: Pearl S. Buck
books.summary: In a remote Chinese village, a devoted mother’s fierce love for her family is tested as she struggles to keep them fed, healthy, and together in the face of grinding poverty and looming change.

books.title: The Lost World
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A team of scientists and adventurers explores a prehistoric land.

books.title: The Enormous Room
books.author: E. E. Cummings
books.summary: E. E. Cummings describes the experiences of his and his fellow inmates’ imprisonment during World War I.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: Getting Married
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On the morning of a young couple’s wedding, concerns about what is to come inspire discussions about the institution of marriage.

books.title: Agamemnon
books.author: Aeschylus
books.summary: The titular Greek king returns home from the Trojan war to be greeted by his scheming wife, who plots vengeance.

books.title: Lilith
books.author: George MacDonald
books.summary: After inheriting his ancestral home, a young man discovers another world inside his library and embarks on an allegorical journey.

books.title: The Thirty-Nine Steps
books.author: John Buchan
books.summary: An expatriate returning to England after many years in South Africa is accused of a murder he did not commit, and has to flee from the police and other more dangerous pursuers.

books.title: Ghost Stories
books.author: E. F. Benson
books.summary: A collection of ghost stories by E. F. Benson.

books.title: The Hashish Eater
books.author: Fitz Hugh Ludlow
books.summary: A philosophical contemplation of youthful adventures spent ingesting large doses of psychoactive cannabis extract.

books.title: The Man in the Queue
books.author: Josephine Tey
books.summary: A police inspector is baffled by the case of a man who was stabbed while waiting in a theater queue.

books.title: Red Dusk and the Morrow
books.author: Paul Dukes
books.summary: A newly-minted secret agent is sent to pick up the pieces of Britain’s spy networks after they are shattered by the Red Terror.

books.title: The Everlasting Man
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton takes us through the history of man, rebuking common secular views and presenting the case for the Catholic Church.

books.title: Gitanjali
books.author: Rabindranath Tagore
books.summary: Prose poems of offering translated by the author from the original Bengali.

books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Amateur Cracksman
books.author: E. W. Hornung
books.summary: A British cricketer and his friend steal valuables in this first collection of A. J. Raffles short stories.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.summary: Dante journeys through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven in order to receive salvation and to find divine love.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.
